alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:59PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL BIG HORN AND CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 658 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Ballantine, or 19 miles west of Hardin, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Worden, Ballantine, and Pompeys Pillar. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
